content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

Here is a definition of the `clean_column` function in Julia that performs the desired cleaning on a column name:

```julia
function clean_column(col::String)
    # Lowercase the string
    str = lowercase(col)
    
    # Strip leading and trailing whitespace
    str = strip(str)
    
    # Replace spaces and hyphens with underscores
    str = replace(str, " " => "_")
    str = replace(str, "-" => "_")
    
    return str
end
```

You can use this function as follows:

```julia
julia> clean_column("My Column")
"my_column"

julia> clean_column("my column")
"my_column"

julia> clean_column("my-column")
"my_column"
```

This function is case-insensitive and will consistently return a lowercase version of the input with underscores replacing spaces and hyphens.
